ask:docs/ask-command.md:1.name: ask
ask:docs/ask-command.md:1.description: GuardianAI's interface to the Codebase Steward, allowing you to query your codebase with natural language

children.name: Basic Usage
children.description: The simplest way to use the ask command with a natural language question

metadata.example: guardian-ai ask "How does the authentication system work?"

children.name: Query Types
children.description: Different types of questions that can be asked with the ask command

children.name: Advanced Options
children.description: Additional flags and options for the ask command

children.name: --analysis
children.description: Flag to see more detailed analysis along with the answer

metadata.example: guardian-ai ask "What are the key components in this project?" --analysis

children.name: --verbose
children.description: Flag for maximum detail in the response

metadata.example: guardian-ai ask "How do error boundaries work?" --verbose

children.name: --context
children.description: Flag to provide additional context to help answer the question

metadata.example: guardian-ai ask "Why is this approach used for caching?" --context "The system needs to support offline mode"

children.name: --type
children.description: Flag to explicitly specify the query type

metadata.example: guardian-ai ask "What pattern is used for state management?" --type pattern

Codebase Steward:docs/codebase-steward.m.name: Codebase Steward
Codebase Steward:docs/codebase-steward.m.description: An intelligent agent that provides deep understanding and insights about a codebase, helping developers navigate, understand, and extend projects.

StewardQueryType:docs/codebase-steward.m.name: StewardQueryType
StewardQueryType:docs/codebase-steward.m.description: Enum defining the different types of queries supported by the Codebase Steward.

children.name: EXPLANATION
children.description: Query type for general code explanation

children.name: ARCHITECTURE
children.description: Query type for high-level architecture analysis

children.name: IMPLEMENTATION
children.description: Query type for implementation guidance

children.name: PATTERN
children.description: Query type for code pattern identification

children.name: RELATIONSHIP
children.description: Query type for component dependency analysis

children.name: BUG
children.description: Query type for bug analysis and fixing guidance

children.name: STANDARD
children.description: Query type for codebase conventions and standards

VectorizedCodebaseStewardService:docs/co.name: VectorizedCodebaseStewardService
VectorizedCodebaseStewardService:docs/co.description: Main service class for the Codebase Steward that provides code understanding capabilities.

children.name: initialize
children.description: Initializes the steward service

children.name: query
children.description: Queries the steward with a natural language question
children.signature: query(question: string, queryType: StewardQueryType, options: { maxTokens: number, includeAnalysis: boolean }): Promise<QueryResult>

children.name: getPatterns
children.description: Identifies code patterns using vector similarity and LLM analysis
children.signature: getPatterns(options: { confidence: number, limit: number }): Promise<Pattern[]>

children.name: getRelationships
children.description: Gets relationships between components
children.signature: getRelationships(component?: string, options?: { types: string[], depth: number }): Promise<Relationship[]>

children.name: getLivingStandards
children.description: Extracts and maintains documentation of coding standards from the codebase

children.name: analyzeAspect
children.description: Analyzes specific aspects of the codebase
children.signature: analyzeAspect(aspect: string, options: { depth: number, focus: string }): Promise<AspectAnalysis>

children.name: getImplementationGuidance
children.description: Provides detailed guidance for implementing new features
children.signature: getImplementationGuidance(feature: string, options: { existingComponents: string[], technicalConstraints: string[] }): Promise<ImplementationGuidance>

Pattern Execution Framework:docs/llm-dir.name: Pattern Execution Framework
Pattern Execution Framework:docs/llm-dir.description: Core framework for LLM-directed indexing with features like relationship mapping, chunking, symbol extraction, and JSON handling

children.name: Flexible Relationship Mapping
children.description: Allows LLM to define any relationship types found in code with robust error handling and schema-free approach

children.name: Pattern-Based Chunking & Symbol Extraction
children.description: Custom chunking strategies defined by the LLM with multiple symbol extraction approaches, adaptive to different codebases and languages

children.name: JSON Response Handling
children.description: Enhanced extraction and repair for truncated responses with multiple fallback strategies and graceful degradation for malformed JSON

children.name: Vector Storage Integration
children.description: Implemented using Vectra, a lightweight file-based vector database with local storage, in-memory search, and metadata filtering

children.name: Embedding Generation
children.description: Integrated with OpenAI embedding API with caching system, batch processing, and support for configurable models

children.name: Vectorized Indexing Service
children.description: Enhanced LLM-directed indexing with vector storage, vector representations for code symbols and relationships, and semantic search capabilities

Codebase Steward Implementation:docs/llm.name: Codebase Steward Implementation
Codebase Steward Implementation:docs/llm.description: Implementation plan for the Codebase Steward component (3 weeks)

children.name: Steward Query Interface
children.description: API for querying the indexed codebase with helper functions and semantic search capabilities

children.name: Pattern Analysis System
children.description: System for analyzing code patterns, detecting coding standards, and generating living standards documentation

children.name: Contextual Knowledge Representation
children.description: Format for storing and updating Steward's knowledge about the codebase with prioritization for relevant context

Steward-Implementer Communication:docs/l.name: Steward-Implementer Communication
Steward-Implementer Communication:docs/l.description: Communication system between Steward and Implementer components (2 weeks)

children.name: Communication Protocol
children.description: Message format between Steward and Implementer with structured format for implementation guidance and context window management

children.name: Briefing Generation System
children.description: System for generating implementation briefings with relevance filtering and code examples

children.name: Feedback Loop
children.description: Mechanism for Implementer to request clarification, Steward to evaluate output, and iterative refinement

TUI Components & Task System:docs/llm-di.name: TUI Components & Task System
TUI Components & Task System:docs/llm-di.description: Terminal User Interface components and task management system (2 weeks)

children.name: Task Management
children.description: Task definition interface with state tracking and history management

children.name: Visualization Components
children.description: Codebase structure visualization, relationship graph display, and pattern highlighting

children.name: Interactive Workflow
children.description: Conversational interface for task refinement, command structure for guiding implementation, and diff display system

GuardianAI:docs/llm-directed-indexing-ro.name: GuardianAI
GuardianAI:docs/llm-directed-indexing-ro.description: System containing the LLM-directed indexing system, Codebase Steward, and Implementer Agent components

Clean, objective, direct, and concise.**.name:
Clean, objective, direct, and concise.**
  - **Free of workarounds, redundant double checks, or unnecessary fallbacks** that arise from AI uncertainty or misunderstanding.
  - **Fully integrated** with the target codebase's core infrastructure, data sources, and existing components.
  - **Strictly adherent** to the specific codebase's observed implementation patterns and defined standards.
- **Our Perspective on LLM Potential
Clean, objective, direct, and concise.**.content:
**Clean, objective, direct, and concise.**
  - **Free of workarounds, redundant double checks, or unnecessary fallbacks** that arise from AI uncertainty or misunderstanding.
  - **Fully integrated** with the target codebase's core infrastructure, data sources, and existing components.
  - **Strictly adherent** to the specific codebase's observed implementation patterns and defined standards.
- **Our Perspective on LLM Potential:**

Focus on Truly Integrated and Clean Code.name: Focus on Truly Integrated and Clean Code
Focus on Truly Integrated and Clean Code.content: **Focus on Truly Integrated and Clean Code:**

GuardianAI:docs/project-vision.md:1.name: GuardianAI
GuardianAI:docs/project-vision.md:1.description: An AI-powered development environment that ensures code quality and integration through a dual-agent system

children.name: Codebase Steward
children.description: An AI agent that analyzes codebases to derive structural relationships, data flows, and patterns, providing guidance to the Implementer Agent

children.name: Implementer Agent
children.description: An AI agent that executes development tasks based on user requests and the Codebase Steward's guidance

children.name: ILLMService
children.description: A flexible service to interface with the latest, most capable LLM models from leading providers

children.name: Comprehensive Codebase Indexing
children.description: Utilizes ASTs, semantic analysis, and pattern recognition to build understanding of project structure

children.name: LLM-Optimized Knowledge Representation
children.description: Processes, stores, and communicates codebase understanding using multifaceted textual formats

children.name: Interactive TUI
children.description: Command-line interface for users to interact with GuardianAI agents

children.name: Multi-LLM Support
children.description: Support for multiple LLM providers through a flexible service interface

AgentActionType:source/services/indexing.content:
export enum AgentActionType {
  ANALYZE_CODEBASE = 'ANALYZE_CODEBASE',     // Initial analysis of codebase structure
  DESIGN_INDEX_STRATEGY = 'DESIGN_INDEX_STRATEGY', // Design the indexing strategy
  ANALYZE_FILE = 'ANALYZE_FILE',           // Analyze a specific file
  DESIGN_FILE_CHUNKING = 'DESIGN_FILE_CHUNKING', // Design the chunking strategy for a file
  EXTRACT_SYMBOLS = 'EXTRACT_SYMBOLS',       // Extract symbols from a file
  ANALYZE_RELATIONSHIPS = 'ANALYZE_RELATIONSHIPS', // Analyze relationships between symbols
  ENHANCE_SYMBOL_METADATA = 'ENHANCE_SYMBOL_METADATA', // Add additional metadata to symbols
  SUGGEST_IMPROVEMENTS = 'SUGGEST_IMPROVEMENTS',   // Suggest improvements to the indexing strategy
}
AgentActionType:source/services/indexing.signature:
ANALYZE_CODEBASE = 'ANALYZE_CODEBASE',     // Initial analysis of codebase structure
  DESIGN_INDEX_STRATEGY = 'DESIGN_INDEX_STRATEGY', // Design the indexing strategy
  ANALYZE_FILE = 'ANALYZE_FILE',           // Analyze a specific file
  DESIGN_FILE_CHUNKING = 'DESIGN_FILE_CHUNKING', // Design the chunking strategy for a file
  EXTRACT_SYMBOLS = 'EXTRACT_SYMBOLS',       // Extract symbols from a file
  ANALYZE_RELATIONSHIPS = 'ANALYZE_RELATIONSHIPS', // Analyze relationships between symbols
  ENHANCE_SYMBOL_METADATA = 'ENHANCE_SYMBOL_METADATA', // Add additional metadata to symbols
  SUGGEST_IMPROVEMENTS = 'SUGGEST_IMPROVEMENTS',   // Suggest improvements to the indexing strategy

properties.name: refinement
properties.description: Optional rules for refining/filtering detected relationships
